primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God's irrevocable faithfulness to Israel as the foundation for the inclusion of the Gentiles and the salvation of the world.

tekstueel_bewijs: God has not rejected his people whom he foreknew
God is actively at work to redeem the world
God has reached out to grasp the whole human race

object.identificatie: The redemption/inclusion of both Jews and Gentiles

tekstueel_bewijs: the gifts and the call of God are irrevocable
bestows his riches upon all who call upon him

helper.identificatie: The Apostle Paul / The 'Israelite' heritage / Christ
tekstueel_bewijs: of their race... is the Christ

tegenstander.identificatie: Unbelief / Human Failure / Rejection of the Gospel
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Unbelief is treated not just as a mistake but as a state that God paradoxically uses to accomplish a larger redemptive purpose.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of lament and commitment to the 'search' for God.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / Paul / Binx Bolling
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human 'search' is only possible because God has first 'found' the human.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God's Irrevocable Call → Salvation/Riches → Jews and Gentiles

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has not rejected his people
God has reached out to grasp the whole human race
God revealed himself to those who did not ask
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Paul tries to come to terms
we must reckon with the failure
we stand fast... by grace alone

voorbeelden: I could wish that I myself were accursed
we need to know the Bible
We are held, not by our own efforts, but by God’s own mercy.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's 'ability' and 'power' to save even through human 'inability' (unbelief).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (fear of rejection) through ~S1 (the reality of unbelief) to S1 (the irrevocable grace of God).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God uses ~S1 (unbelief) to facilitate ~S2 (inclusion of Gentiles), ultimately leading back to S1 for all.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the Holocaust and the 'man in the class' represent the terrifying possibility of S2.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently positions God as the active Subject of salvation and human beings as the receivers of an 'irrevocable' call.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: we must reckon with the failure of Christians

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: the gifts and the call of God are irrevocable

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Paul and Moses are used as windows into the mind of Christ, not as moral templates for the hearer to replicate by their own power.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: Their willingness to be damned reflects Christ's substitutionary work.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and security in God's faithfulness.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God's mercy is the final word.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative of Israel's history is perfectly integrated into the gospel of grace for the hearer.
spanning_punten: The tension between human unbelief and divine election.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Christ himself, who gave himself up to condemnation on the Cross in our place.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit bears witness to the truth of the Subject's (God's) action.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; described as 'trespass' and 'failure' that requires divine intervention.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. God is the Subject of the primary program (Salvation), and the hearer is the Receiver.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The emphasis on 'God revealed himself to those who did not ask' is theologically vital.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's call) precedes and enables Ethics (the search/commitment).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A profound example of how to preach the 'hard' texts of Romans by keeping the focus on the agency of God.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'lament' and 'clue' metaphors, Greimas reveals that these are functional helpers to the Subject (God).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the text; semiotics explains how the text 'works' on the hearer by assigning them the role of Receiver rather than Hero.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'unbelief' of Israel functions as a narrative 'Opponent' that God converts into a 'Helper' for Gentile inclusion.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'clue' metaphor to shift the hearer from an active searcher to one who is 'found'.
